clauncher.name: Clauncher
entries: Remix Clauncher puffs up its claws and fans its tail in a serpentine display meant to mimic dragons. If intimidation fails, it unleashes high-heat bursts from its blaster claw, occasionally igniting its own shell in the process as it's shell has not fully developed to handle the intense heat.
clauncher.title: Decoy Shell

clawitzer.name: Clawitzer
entries: This variant of Clawitzer has evolved to mimic a threatening dragon's appearance to ward off larger predators. They can still manuever through water with ease.
Despite not being a Dragon-type, this crustacean has the firepower to back up its intimidating appearance! This firepower is useful for burning up prey too!
clawitzer.title: Inferno Shrimp

combee.name: Clawitzer
entries: This variant of Combee gives off a faint floral scent that lures curious Pokémon close—only to inflict them with an unsavory neurotoxin. Each face takes turns smiling.
The various heads of this Combee vary in their mood. Some seem to enjoy inflicting pain, while others are in distress watching their fellow Combee take pleasure in this pain.
combee.title: Toxic Drone

vespiquen.name: Vespiquen
entries: Remix Combee will supply Vespiquen with the proper diet to fuel her neurotoxin. If she is interrupted while feeding, she will lash out without mercy.
It brews its own potent neurotoxin within their body. When injected, this neurotoxin will cause intense infatuation, madness, and pain.
Vespiquen's remix form no longer needs to physically command her swarm—her pheromones alone are enough to keep her Combee in submission.
vespiquen.title: Malevolent Queen

nidoranf.name: NidoranF
entries: Small but dangerous, this Nidoran variant uses its cutesy appearance to lure enemies close before striking with its poison tipped spikes or claws. The poison it secretes has a glittery sheen.
nidoranf.title: Toxic Charm

nidorina.name: Nidorina
entries: This Pokémon forms close-knit groups with others of its kind, acting as a protector with toxic force. Its soft appearance hides sharp instincts and sharper spikes.
nidorina.title: Venom Guard

nidoqueen.name: Nidoqueen
entries: Though no longer Poison-type, this Nidoqueen secretes healing toxins through her skin to heal herself. However, this poison is still deadly to those outside of her species.
Nidoqueen's nurturing presence is only matched by her brutal physical strength—especially when defending her territory. Her hard plated breast armor is especially durable.
nidoqueen.title: Matriarch

nidoranm.name: NidoranM
entries: Its tiny body stores enough voltage to knock out a full grown Kangaskhan, and it still has venom potent enough to put one on its back! Trainers often report strange tingling sensations after petting it—despite repeated warnings.
nidoranm.title: Shock Spine

nidorino.name: Nidorino
entries: This Pokemon wields both venom and electricity as defense mechanisms. They are highly aggressive and quick to anger. The angrier it gets, the brighter their vents glow.
nidorino.title: Horn Generator

nidoking.name: Nidoking
entries: Despite not being Poison type, venom still courses through its body and can be weaponized for offense, or used to heal itself and fuel its electric energy.

Nidoking's power output triples when poisoned and it becomes even faster and more aggressive. It has been witnessed intentionally poisoning itself in the wild to win territorial battles against other Nidoking.
nidoking.title: Thunder Crash
